Class LineString

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.tak.api.engine.map.features.Geometry

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable
    public final class LineString
extends Geometry
    An open or closed string of connected points geometry

      • LineString

        public LineString​(int dimension)
        Create a line string with a dimension of 2D or 3D
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint​(double x,
                     double y)
        Adds the specified point to the linestring. If the linestring is 3D, a z-coordinate of '0' will be assumed.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint​(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z)
        Adds the specified point to the linestring. If the linestring is 2D, TE_IllegalState is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        z - The z-coordinate

      • addPoints

        public void addPoints​(double[] pts,
                      int off,
                      int numPts,
                      int ptsDim)
        Adds the specified points to the linestring. If 'ptsDim' is '2' and the linestring is 2D, the z-coordinate for all points will be assumed to be '0'.
        Parameters:
        pts - The points, interleaved by component
        off - The offset into pts to start at
        numPts - The number of points
        ptsDim - The dimension of the points

      • getNumPoints

        public int getNumPoints()
        Returns the number of points in the linestring.

      • getX

        public double getX​(int i)
        Returns the x-coordinate of the specified point.
        Parameters:
        i - The point index

      • getY

        public double getY​(int i)
        Returns the y-coordinate of the specified point.
        Parameters:
        i - The point index

      • getZ

        public double getZ​(int i)
        Returns the z-coordinate of the specified point.
        Parameters:
        i - The point index

      • get

        public void get​(Point point,
                int i)
        Returns the specified point. The supplied Point2 will have its dimension reset to the dimension of this linestring.
        Parameters:
        point - Returns the point
        i - The point index

      • setX

        public void setX​(int i,
                 double x)
        Sets the x-coordinate of the specified point.
        Parameters:
        i - The point index
        x - The x-coordinate

      • setY

                 double y)
        Sets the y-coordinate of the specified point.
        Parameters:
        i - The point index
        y - The y-coordinate

      • setZ

        public void setZ​(int i,
                 double z)
        Sets the z-coordinate of the specified point.
        Parameters:
        i - The point index
        z - The z-coordinate

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns 'true' if the linestring is closed (first point equals end point), 'false' otherwise.
